intro: Baissea mortehanii, commonly known as the Ethiopian star grass, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grasses. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in high-altitude regions. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
